Problem:
Consider the effect of a Laplace transform on a function \\( g(t) = e^{At} \\) with a constant matrix A on a complex function space. The transformed function is \\( \\hat{g}(s) \\). We will analyze the function after applying an inverse Laplace transform, possibly with an operational matrix M applied to it.

Given \\( g^{\\prime}(t) \\) obtained directly by inverse transforming \\( \\hat{g}(s) \\) back to time space, can we confirm that this originated from \\( g(t) = e^{At} \\) without additional transformations?
Explanation: Given the properties of the Laplace transform and its uniqueness under proper conditions, the inverse Laplace transform of \\( \\hat{g}(s) \\) back to \\( g^{\\prime}(t) \\) will confirm that it originated from \\( g(t) = e^{At} \\) as long as no further operational transformations were applied and initial conditions are identifiable.
